Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the House GOP health care bill on preexisting conditions by stating that insurers can charge "thousands more" for such conditions.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of the House GOP health care bill on preexisting conditions by not fully explaining the potential consequences for individuals with preexisting health conditions.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that insurers can charge "thousands more" for preexisting conditions under the bill.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the House GOP health care bill will have a significant negative impact on individuals with preexisting conditions without providing enough context or evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the provisions on preexisting conditions in the House GOP health care bill.
